text:
привет! Программа следующая 
The goal of this course is to teach both classical computer vision techniques and modern deep learning methods for computer vision problems. We will start from brief introduction to computer vision, including basic image processing techniques, and will then move to deep learning for image classification and object detection. We will also present video analysis and image synthesis / stylization methods.  

Course Learning Objectives:
In this course, a learner will be able to:
•	Understand the design principles underlying complex neural networks architectures in the computer vision field.
•	Prepare and efficiently manipulate large annotated image datasets, discover and fix hand-labelling problems.
•	Train and apply deep neural networks for image classification, image retrieval and style transfer.
•	Train and apply deep neural networks for object detection and segmentation.
•	Understand and use basic techniques for video processing
•	Solve computer vision problems with combination of deep models and classical computer vision algorithms

During the course, students will develop a face recognition program. This project is divided into weekly programming assignments. The basic variant of the project involves face recognition from still images. This basic program can then be extended in two different ways. The first way is adding the support for face recognition in video. The second way is to add face manipulation.

Introduction and digital images
•	Short introduction to computer vision
•	Course project overview
•	Structure of human eye and vision
•	Digital images
Color models

Basic image processing
•	Image processing goals and tasks
•	Contrast correction
•	Image convolution
•	Edge detection

Image classification
Recap of image classification
AlexNet, VGG, Inception
ResNet and beyond
Fine-grained image classification
Detection and classification of facial attributes

Content-based image retrieval
Overview of content-based image retrieval
Extracting semantic image embeddings using a pretrained convolutional neural network
Employing indexing structures for efficient retrieval of semantic neighbor
Face verification 
The re-identification problem in computer vision

Keypoints regression
Keypoints regression problems
CNN for keypoints regression


Sliding window detectors
Object detection problem
Sliding windows
HOG-based detector
Cascade-based detectors
Cascade-based detectors and neural networks


Modern detector architectures
From R-CNN to Faster R-CNN
Single shot detectors
Fully Convolutional Network
Datasets and state-of-the-art


Object tracking
Video recognition and optical flow
Visual object tracking (VOT)
Multiple object tracking (MOT)


Action recognition
Action recognition problems and datasets
Action classification with space-time interest points
Action classification with neural networks
Action detection


Image segmentation
Image segmentation problems
Oversegmentation
Deep learning models for image segmentation
Human pose estimation as image segmentation


Style transfer and image generation
Style transfer 
Generative adversarial networks
Image transformation with neural networks

В курсере при записи на новую сессию курса, все материалы "будущих" недель становятся недоступны. Раньше такого не было. Учитывайте это, если хотите прослушать курс бесплатно а потом сдать все задания за неделю.

Там при этом тихо сидеть приходится или можно даже вопросы задавать Мэннингу какому-нибудь?
так задумано, но это же курсера, а они не всегда могут... если открыть любое видео из доступных (или тест) то дальше навигация возможна через кнопку "Next/Дальше" :smekalka:
Всегда сохраняю в облако если курс понравился
